discovery.pattern: Direct file path with manual reading
discovery.instruction: In VS Code with Copilot, open {worker_file} and ask Copilot to read and follow the instructions

documentation.getting_started: GitHub Copilot can work with Czarina workflows through VS Code. Open the worker file and use Copilot Chat to ask it to read and follow the task instructions. Copilot Chat (@workspace feature) can reference the worker file context.
tips: Use Copilot Chat with @workspace to include worker file in context
Open the worker file first, then ask Copilot to 'read this file and follow the instructions'
For git operations, use the Source Control panel or terminal with gh CLI
Copilot works best with incremental, focused tasks from the worker prompt
Use inline completions for code implementation, Chat for understanding instructions
Keep worker file open in a split pane for reference
limitations: Does not automatically read referenced files - requires explicit instruction
Best used in combination with manual workflow management
May need to break down complex worker prompts into smaller steps
PR creation requires gh CLI or manual GitHub workflow

examples.title: Start a task with Copilot Chat
examples.description: Ask Copilot to help with a worker task
examples.command: Open worker file, then in Copilot Chat: '@workspace Read the worker file in the editor and help me complete these tasks'

examples.title: Reference worker context
examples.command: Copilot Chat: 'Based on @{worker_file}, implement the next task'
